page.title: 08GREAT LODGE FARM
page.content: Great Lodge Farm situated just to the north east of the village of Hanbury is a large farm of three hundred and fifty acres. The present farmers have been at Great Lodge for the last forty years and other members of their family farm on the nearby Park Farm and Skirgens Farm. The total area of these three farms is about seven hundred acres. Five people are employed as full time workers on Great Lodge Farm. A small part of the land belongs to the {Hanbury Hall}Estate. The land is mainly grass but some crops are grown. These are wheat and barley. There are one hundred milking cows which are Fresian and about one hundred Hereford Cross beef cattle.
